verses.verse: A Song <S%H7892><s%> or Psalm <S%H4210><s%> of Asaph. <S%H623><s%> Keep not thou silence, <S%H408><s%> <S%H1824><s%> O God: <S%H430><s%> hold not thy peace, <S%H2790><s%> <S%H408><s%> and be not <S%H408><s%> still, <S%H8252><s%> O God. <S%H410><s%>
For, <S%H3588><s%> lo, <S%H2009><s%> thine enemies <S%H341><s%> make a tumult: <S%H1993><s%> and they that hate <S%H8130><s%> thee have lifted up <S%H5375><s%> the head. <S%H7218><s%>
They have taken crafty <S%H6191><s%> counsel <S%H5475><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> thy people, <S%H5971><s%> and consulted <S%H3289><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> thy hidden ones. <S%H6845><s%>

They have said, <S%H559><s%> Come, <S%H1980><s%> and let us cut them off <S%H3582><s%> from being a nation; <S%H4480><s%> <S%H1471><s%> that the name <S%H8034><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> may be no <S%H3808><s%> more <S%H5750><s%> in remembrance. <S%H2142><s%>
For <S%H3588><s%> they have consulted together <S%H3289><s%> with one consent: <S%H3820><s%> <S%H3162><s%> they are confederate <S%H1285><s%> <S%H3772><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> thee:
The tabernacles <S%H168><s%> of Edom, <S%H123><s%> and the Ishmaelites; <S%H3459><s%> of Moab, <S%H4124><s%> and the Hagarenes; <S%H1905><s%>
Gebal, <S%H1381><s%> and Ammon, <S%H5983><s%> and Amalek; <S%H6002><s%> the Philistines <S%H6429><s%> with <S%H5973><s%> the inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of Tyre; <S%H6865><s%>

Assur <S%H804><s%> also <S%H1571><s%> is joined <S%H3867><s%> with <S%H5973><s%> them: they have <S%H1961><s%> helped <S%H2220><s%> the children <S%H1121><s%> of Lot. <S%H3876><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%>
Do <S%H6213><s%> unto them as unto the Midianites; <S%H4080><s%> as to Sisera, <S%H5516><s%> as to Jabin, <S%H2985><s%> at the brook <S%H5158><s%> of Kison: <S%H7028><s%>
Which perished <S%H8045><s%> at Endor: <S%H5874><s%> they became <S%H1961><s%> as dung <S%H1828><s%> for the earth. <S%H127><s%>

Make <S%H7896><s%> their nobles <S%H5081><s%> like Oreb, <S%H6159><s%> and like Zeeb: <S%H2062><s%> yea, all <S%H3605><s%> their princes <S%H5257><s%> as Zebah, <S%H2078><s%> and as Zalmunna: <S%H6759><s%>
Who <S%H834><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> Let us take <S%H3423><s%> to ourselves <S%H853><s%> the houses <S%H4999><s%> of God <S%H430><s%> in possession.
O my God, <S%H430><s%> make <S%H7896><s%> them like a wheel; <S%H1534><s%> as the stubble <S%H7179><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the wind. <S%H7307><s%>
As the fire <S%H784><s%> burneth <S%H1197><s%> a wood, <S%H3293><s%> and as the flame <S%H3852><s%> setteth the mountains on fire; <S%H2022><s%> <S%H3857><s%>
So <S%H3651><s%> persecute <S%H7291><s%> them with thy tempest, <S%H5591><s%> and make them afraid <S%H926><s%> with thy storm. <S%H5492><s%>
Fill <S%H4390><s%> their faces <S%H6440><s%> with shame; <S%H7036><s%> that they may seek <S%H1245><s%> thy name, <S%H8034><s%> O LORD. <S%H3068><s%>
Let them be confounded <S%H954><s%> and troubled <S%H926><s%> forever; <S%H5704><s%> <S%H5703><s%> yea, let them be put to shame, <S%H2659><s%> and perish: <S%H6><s%>

That men may know <S%H3045><s%> that <S%H3588><s%> thou, <S%H859><s%> whose name <S%H8034><s%> alone <S%H905><s%> is JEHOVAH, <S%H3068><s%> art the most high <S%H5945><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the earth. <S%H776><s%>
